entries: Dim, greenish light spreads within a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The light spreads around corners, and it lasts until the spell ends.

When a creature moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} radiant damage, and it suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} and emits a dim, greenish light in a 5-foot radius. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage, doesn’t suffer {@condition exhaustion}, and doesn’t emit light. This light makes it impossible for the creature to benefit from being {@condition invisible}. The light and any levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell go away when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Black Venom Bolts
entries: Three hissing, dripping orbs of sour tar hurtle outward from your open hand at targets within range. You can hurl these at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each orb. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} poison damage and must succeed a Constitution saving throw. A target hit by multiple orbs only rolls one save, but does so at disadvantage. On a failure, the target is {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned} by this spell, the target's speed is halved.

At the start of each of its turns, a {@condition poisoned} target can make another Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d8} poison damage on a failure. On a success, the spell ends on that target. Any spell that ends the {@condition poisoned} condition also ends this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional orb for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Animate Plants
entries: Plants come to life at your command. Choose up to ten non-magical plants within range. Medium targets count as two plants, Large targets count as four plants, Huge targets count as eight plants. You can't animate any object larger than Huge. Each target animates and becomes a creature under your control until the spell ends or until reduced to 0 hit points.

As a bonus action, you can mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 500 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

An animated plant gains an AC, hit points, attacks, Strength, and Dexterity determined by its size. Its Constitution is 10 and its Intelligence and Wisdom are 3, and its Charisma is 1. It has vulnerability to fire damage. It uproots itself and moves about by twisting or standing on its roots. It has a speed and climb speed of 30 feet. If an animated plant is anchored by some other object than its roots that prevents movement, its speed is 0. It has blindsight with a radius of 30 feet and is blind beyond that distance. When the animated plant drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original object form, and any remaining damage carries over to its original object form.

If you command a plant to attack, it can make a single melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. It makes a slam attack with an attack bonus and bludgeoning damage determined by its size. The DM might rule that a specific plant inflicts slashing or piercing damage based on its form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can animate two additional plants for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Blackfire

components.m: dust from a vampire that was killed by sunlight

entries: A ray of black necromantic fire shoots from your fingertip toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target is engulfed in chilling black fire that feeds on their life force. A creature affected by this spell has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. At the start of each of its turns, the creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion} and be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the target must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or have the black flames spread to them, affecting them as another target of the spell.

Any creature who is killed by this spell and everything they are wearing or carrying, except magic items, is reduced to a pile of black ash. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

If a creature affected by this spell successfully saves against it three times, the spell ends on that creature. These magical flames cannot be extinguished by nonmagical means, though they are affected by dispel magic, remove curse, or similar spells. A creature affected by the death ward spell is immune to this spell’s effects. This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.

spell.name: Fiery Eyes
entries: Your eyes become blazing pinpoints of fire and your gaze becomes searing. Your vision casts bright light in a 60-foot cone, and dim light 60 feet beyond that. On each of your turns as a bonus action, you can focus your gaze upon a creature within 60 feet, forcing it to make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If you continue to target the same creature on subsequent turns, that creature takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage for each round it has been targeted.
Also as your bonus action, your gaze can ignite flammable objects that aren't being worn or

spell.name: Cataclysm

components.m: a chunk of granite, a pinch of sulfur, and a vial of spring water

entries: You call upon the primordial elements to rend asunder everything within a 120-foot radius of a point within range. The ground within the area begins to rumble and crack as vents of hot steam begin to spew forth, making the area difficult terrain for the duration of the spell.

At the start of your next turn, a 100-foot tall volcano erupts from the earth to fill the area. Creatures within the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or fall {@condition prone}.

Creatures within a 20-foot radius of the center must also succeed a Strength saving throw or immediately sink into a lava-filled crater. On a failure, the creature is {@condition restrained} by the lava and takes {@damage 10d8} fire damage. On a success, a creature takes half damage and can use their reaction to move up to their speed so that it is no longer within the crater.  Each foot that a creature moves through the lava costs 4 feet of movement. A creature must also make a Strength saving throw when it moves into the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. On a failure, it takes {@damage 10d8} fire damage and is {@condition restrained}. On a success, it takes half damage and can move freely. A {@condition restrained} creature can use an action to repeat the saving throw to end the {@condition restrained} condition.

Fiery embers and ash rain down on the area, forcing creatures that start their turn within the area to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 5d8} fire damage, halved on a success. The embers ignite flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

entries.name: Structures
entries: The eruption deals 100 bludgeoning damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area. If a structure drops to 0 hit points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature down the volcanic slope from the structure must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d8} bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, swept to the base of the volcano, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the nature of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone}, fall down the volcano, or become buried.
When the spell ends, the lava cools and the volcano becomes a permanent mound of earth and rock.

spell.name: Celestial Spear
entries: A massive radiant spear comes crashing down from the heavens, attempting to pierce a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} piercing damage and {@damage 4d8} radiant damage as they are impaled by the spear.

An impaled target is fixed to the point where they were struck. The first time the target tries to move it must first make a Strength saving throw. On a success, the target can move using 2 feet of movement for each foot it moves for the duration of the spell. On a failure, it cannot try to move again until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Chant of Mercy
entries: You call upon the higher powers to intercede on your behalf. For the duration, you may use your reaction each round to cause a friendly creature within a 30-foot radius to reroll an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw and take the new roll. You must decide to do this after the die has been rolled, but before the outcome has been determined.

spell.name: Chant of Zakeb
entries: The howling ululations of Zakeb emanate from you, burning minds and bodies with their blasphemies and echoing out to 300 feet. Each creature that can hear you within a 60-foot radius must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} acid damage and {@damage 3d8} psychic damage as seeping wounds begin to open upon their bodies. On a successful save, a target takes half damage.
Each round, you can use an action to maintain the chant, forcing creatures that can hear you to make the saving throw again. The spell ends if you ever use your action to do something else.
This spell has no effect on constructs, undead, or creatures that cannot hear you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this some using a 7th level spell slot or higher, either the acid or the psychic damage (your choice) increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Confluence
entries: You utter the forbidden incantations of N'aix and transform yourself into a parasitic mist that immediately enters a creature. You suffuse through the target's body, becoming one with it, perceiving through its senses, exchanging surface thoughts, and communicating with it freely through your mind. For all purposes you are considered indistinguishable from the target and are granted total cover within them. Abilities such as truesight that perceive the true form of a shapechanger will identify your presence.
The effects of this spell differ depending on whether the target is willing.

entries.name: Symbiosis
entries: You are absorbed into the willing target's body. As a reaction you can dismiss the spell early and burst forth violently from the target, forcing all other creatures in a 20-foot radius to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage.

entries.name: Infestation
entries: You make a melee spell attack against a creature. On a hit, you successfully enter the body of that creature. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can make a Constitution saving throw. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails its save three times, it stops making saving throws, and the spell will continue for its full duration unless you use a reaction to end it.

As a reaction you can dismiss the spell early and rip yourself from the target’s body, instantly slaying it. Everything within a 20-foot radius is showered in chunks of gore as their body is totally obliterated. You regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt to the target.

While using either of these forms you cannot cast or concentrate on spells, and are resistant to all forms of damage except psychic and poison. Any damage taken by the target is also applied to you. If the spell ends you appear in an open space within 5 feet of them. This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a 8th level spell slot, the duration is 24 hours. When casting this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the duration is 1 week.

spell.name: Corpse Walk

m.text: a black gemstone worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: As part of this spell, you specially prepare the corpse of a humanoid, carving a symbol into the back of its neck. The corpse must have intact eyes or ears, a complete torso, and have been dead no longer than ten days for the spell to work. For the duration of the spell, the target does not decay. When the duration expires, it rapidly decays equivalent to the amount of days it spent under the spell.

As an action, you can concentrate to take direct control of the corpse, seeing and hearing through it. If the corpse has the capacity to speak, you can speak through it normally. During this time you are blind and deaf with regard to your own senses. While you are controlling it, the corpse is considered undead. It has 10 hit points, 30 feet of movement, uses your mental abilities scores, and has physical abilities scores of 10.

You can take direct control of the corpse by using your action to concentrate so long as it is on the same plane as you. The spell ends if more than half of the corpse is destroyed, it loses the ability to hear and see, or the mark carved into its neck is destroyed or defaced. You can have a number of corpses affected by this spell at any one time equal to your Spellcasting ability modifier.

When the corpse is inactive, it is hidden from divination magic. According to all forms of magical detection it is an ordinary corpse. The mark that is created as part of this spell is considered non-magical while inactive.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, it lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Crescent Blade
entries: A horizontal, spinning spectral blade launches from your arm toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} slashing damage.
Pick a different target within 30 feet of the first and make another ranged spell attack as the blade magically redirects toward them. On a hit, the new target takes {@damage 3d8} slashing damage.

The blade continues bouncing. Each time the blade makes a new attack, the damage reduces by {@dice 1d8} until it reaches 0 and disappears. The blade redirects to a new target within 30 feet even if the attack misses. The blade can bounce back to a target it has hit previously so long as it hits a new target first.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a 6th level spell slot or higher, the slashing damage increases by {@dice 1d8}, allowing the blade to bounce an additional time for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Consecrated Ground
entries: Cracks spilling radiant light spread out from you as you declare the ground on which you stand within a 30-foot radius to be consecrated ground. For the duration, you and your allies within the area gain 5 temporary hit points at the start of each of their turns, and have advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

spell.name: Daze
entries: You point at a creature you can see within 30 feet with {@dice 6d10} hit points or less and force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. Creatures immune to charm are immune to this effect.
The maximum hit points of the target increases by {@dice 2d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 8d10}), 11th level ({@dice 10d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 12d10}).

spell.name: Death Chime
entries: A massive spectral bell begins to toll as the shadow of death descends over everything within range. Every creature within 60 feet of you when you cast this spell, except for those you specifically exclude by name, begin to hear the deep tone of the bell, even if they normally cannot hear. Creatures affected by this spell immediately know what the bell means and who is casting it.

When you cast this spell, and at the end of each of your turns for the duration, the bell tolls and each affected creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, an affected creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell go away when the spell ends. This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.

spell.name: Disjoint
entries: You point your finger at a creature within range and attempt to place a magical disjunction upon them. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be rendered unable to use magical items or objects for the duration.

For the duration, magical items or objects do not work for the target. The target cannot expend charges, use command words, or otherwise activate any magical effects. The target is also considered unattuned from any magical items for the duration of the spell. Innate magical bonuses that do not require attunement such as those imparted by a +1 weapon still apply.

spell.name: Finnic's Ridiculous Shot

m.text: a piece of ammunition, which the spell consumes

entries: When you cast this spell, you launch the piece of ammunition for a ranged weapon used in the casting of this spell directly upwards and it immediately disappears.

At any time before the spell ends, you can use a reaction to end the spell early and cause the projectile to reappear coming down from directly above a point within 90 feet. Make a ranged weapon attack according to the weapon you used in the casting of this spell. On a hit, the target takes damage according to the weapon and ammunition you used in the casting of this spell, plus an additional {@damage 3d6} force damage.

spell.name: Geyser

components.m: a lump of clay doused in spring water

entries: A geyser of hot steam sprays upward from a point on the ground within range. Creatures within a 10-foot radius, 30-foot tall cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 3d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The area within 30 feet of the point becomes lightly obscured as it is misted and showered with water from the geyser.

At the start of each of your turns, the geyser releases another burst of steam, causing creatures in the area to make another Dexterity save or take {@damage 3d6} fire damage, halved on a success, and raining down water.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, the fire damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Iron Maiden
entries: You create a transparent barrier of sharp floating spikes that encompass a Large or smaller creature you can see within range. The spikes appear in a shell pointing inwards and last for the duration. The spikes do not impede small movements that are contained within the target's space or allow it to interact with adjacent spaces.

When the target moves or is moved any distance, the spikes resist the movement and pierce its flesh. The first time the target moves since the start of its turn, or is moved by an outside force, it takes {@damage 4d6} piercing damage.

spell.name: Light of Heaven

m.text: a holy symbol worth at least 1,000 gp

entries: The brilliant light of the heavens beams down upon a location you specify within range. Until the spell ends, a 120-foot-radius, 1 mile tall cylinder of blinding lights shines down there. This light is sunlight.

When the cylinder appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure a creature is also {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. A creature must also make this saving throw whenever it ends its turn in the cylinder.

When you cast the spell, choose three points you can see within the cylinder. An awesome beam of radiance flashes down upon that point. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d10} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure a creature is also {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. A creature in the area of more than one radiant beam is affected only once. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to move the cylinder up to 60 feet and call down the radiant beams in this way again, targeting the same points or different ones.
If a creature fails three saves in one casting of this spell, they are permanently {@condition blinded}.

spell.name: Maledict
entries: You point at a creature within range and brand it with foul luck. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the first time the target makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw before the spell ends, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from their total. Then the spell ends.

spell.name: Mana Void

time.condition: which you take immediately after you see a creature within 30 feet of you cast a spell

entries: You take advantage of the negative space of energy left in the wake of casting a spell. The creature that cast the spell is immediately struck by a backlash of destructive force, dealing {@damage 1d10} force damage {@dice 1d10} per level of the spell. If the damage from this spell requires the creature to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, they have disadvantage.

spell.name: Mass Message
entries: Choose up to six creatures within a 300-foot radius and whisper a message. The targets (and only the targets) hear the message.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with a target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks the spell. The spell doesn't have to follow a straight line and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of creatures you can target increases by two for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Matilda's Convenient Courtier
entries: "Have you ever been deep in some dank dungeon of decrepit tower and realized that you've forgotten your favorite crowbar? Are you down a well and lost your trusty grappling hook? Well do not fear! Matilda Everdawn's Convenient Courtier is here for you! With this trusty little merchant, you can purchase any standard good a busy adventurer may need directly from Matilda's warehouse! All purchases are final. Every convenient courtier comes at the cost of a service fee, courtesy of Matilda's Crazy Enterprises."

When you cast this spell, a small spectral servitor appears on the ground within range. The servitor knows common, and can sell you any standard non-magical goods at ten times the standard price. The servitor does not negotiate prices, accept returns, or buy goods from people.

The goods are magically produced in the servitor's hands from an unknown location by inscrutable means. The gold for the items disappears from the possession of the person who requests it. The spell can be ended early if the servitor is informed they are no longer needed. Otherwise, they warn the caster when a minute is left in their buying period. The servitor's appearance and disappearance is accompanied by the jingle of a bell and tinkling of coins.

spell.name: Noactl's Baleful Breath
entries: A sticky green mist blasts from your outstretched hands. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes {@damage 5d8} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned}. On a successful save the target takes half damage and the spell ends on that target.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it must make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the target is no longer {@condition poisoned} and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Noactl's Biting Venom

m.text: a viper's fang

entries: A spectral serpent coils around your body, slithering over you with a hateful glint in its eye. Until the spell ends, you are resistant to poison damage. In addition, whenever a creature within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack, the snake lashes out at the creature, dealing {@damage 3d4} poison damage and forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a spell slot of 4th level, the poison damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Noactl's Deadly Darts
entries: You create three green spectral darts that orbit around your head. When you cast this spell, or as a bonus action before the duration expires, you can send one dart streaking toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage and {@damage 1d4} poison damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 2nd level spell slot, the poison damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Poison Nova
entries: A bloom of toxic mist pulses outward from you, spreading onto everything. Each creature within a 30-foot radius takes {@damage 2d8} poison damage and must succeed a Constitution saving throw or have their hit point maximum reduced by the amount of poison damage taken for the duration. On a successful save, their hit point maximum is not reduced and the spell ends on that target.
At the end of each of its turns, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by {@dice 2d8}, to a minimum of 1.
Any spell that can end the {@condition poisoned} condition ends this effect. When the spell ends, the target's hit point maximum is restored.

spell.name: Psychic Reading
entries: You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. Any residual impressions left by the most recent owner upon the item become known to you. You learn the most recent owner's name, race, sex, age, and alignment. You learn how that owner came to possess the item, and if they lost the item, how they came to lose it. You may also learn about any significant events such as a murder or defeat that occured for the last owner while using the item.

You do not learn any specific magical properties of the item or how to use it. The object must have been possessed by a creature for at least one week to hold an impression of that creature as its owner.

When cast upon an area instead, this spell imparts knowledge of the most significant event to happen in that area, if any. You learn the nature of the event such as a battle, betrayal, or marriage. You learn the general number of creatures involved in the event, the predominant races, and the primary emotions or motivations behind the event.

spell.name: Razor Snow
entries: You create drifts of magical snow consisting of ten 10-foot squares. The snow appears mundane to initial inspection, and requires a Wisdom (survival) check against your spell save DC to reveal it's true nature.

These snowflakes are supernaturally strong and sharp. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage and {@damage 2d6} slashing damage for every 5 feet it travels. Each foot a creature moves through the snow costs 3 feet of movement.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of 10-foot squares you can create increases by four for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Resilience
entries: For the duration, whenever the target takes any damage other than magical bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, it is reduced by {@dice 1d4} to a minimum of 1.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage reduction increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Seed of Chaos
entries: You bring forth a seed of the unspeakable horror that lies in the darkness between the stars. Countless filamentous tendrils begin to rapidly grow and unfurl to cover a 30-foot radius from a point you can see within range. The area is considered difficult terrain for the duration of the spell. Creatures that enter the area for the first time on their turn or start their turn there must succeed a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the tendrils, taking {@damage 5d10} acid damage and {@damage 5d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature is disintegrated if the spell leaves them with 0 hit points.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.
At the start of each of your turns, the radius expands by 10 feet.

spell.name: Spell Echo
entries: You imbue yourself with a recursive magical veil that mimics the spells you cast. While concentrating on this spell, any time you cast a spell of 5th level or lower with a casting time of an action, bonus action, or reaction, it triggers again at the start of your next turn.

The spell that is echoed will target the same area or creatures as the original spell. The echoed spell requires saving throws and attack rolls as normal. The echoed spell originates from you as if you cast it. The spell still follows it's normal limitations such as range or cover.

spell.name: Spell Guard

m.text: a quartz crystal worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You cloak yourself in a faintly shimmering absorptive shield that triggers in response to damage. The next time you take damage during the duration, the incoming damage is halved and the spell ends as the shield immediately explodes. Creatures within a 10-foot radius of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} force damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage.
You can use an action to dismiss the spell early without triggering the explosion.

spell.name: Spell Sense
entries: For the duration, you sense the identity of spells that are cast within 60 feet of you. If you sense a spell in this way, you automatically know what spell is being cast, and what level slot is being used in the casting. You can also use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any. If the target is a creature, you also learn whether it has any spellcasting ability and the highest level spell slot it currently has.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

spell.name: Starfall

m.text: a silver star pendant worth at least 100 gp

entries: You call down a rain of glittering blue-white stars or comets that strike four points of your choice within range. Each creature within a 10-foot radius centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature takes {@damage 3d12} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful. A creature in the area of more than one falling star is affected only once.
This spell deals {@damage 1d12} additional damage to shapechangers, and forces it to immediately revert to its original form on a failed save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radiant damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d12} per slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Static Burst
entries: A shocking burst of static electricity leaps from your body. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage and cannot take reactions until the start of their next turn. On a successful save, the damage is halved and the creature can act normally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Static Storm
entries: You manifest a small rumbling storm cloud that floats 5 feet above your head and moves with you for the duration. When you cast this spell, and at the start of each of your turns for the duration each creature within 15 feet of you must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 3d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot, the lightning damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Stone Fist
entries: A coating of solid stone covers your balled fist and lasts for the duration. If you unclench your fist, the stone crumbles away, but you can remanifest it as a bonus action.
You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the fist. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} force damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed back 5 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the knockback distance increases by 5 feet for every slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Suppress Exhaustion
entries: You magically suppress the {@condition exhaustion} of your allies to grant them the will to press onward. Choose up to four creatures within range. For the duration, each target gains 15 temporary hit points and has their {@condition exhaustion} level reduced by 3. When the spell ends, the targets all regain the 3 levels of {@condition exhaustion}, to a maximum {@condition exhaustion} level of 5.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th level spell slot or higher, the number of creatures you can target increases by two for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sweeping Scythe
entries: A silver flash and the ring of metal swing across a 5-foot wide, 30-foot long line across a point you can see within range. Each creature within the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
The scythe moves from one side of the line to the other in a direction you choose. It is stopped by cover and deflects off of solid objects with a painful ringing sound.

spell.name: Toxic Shock
entries: You point at a location within range, and a blast of viscous yellow slime bursts from that point in a 20-foot radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d10} poison damage. On a success, it takes half damage and the spell ends on that creature.
Creatures affected by this spell cannot restore lost hit points by any means. Any spell that ends the {@condition poisoned} condition ends this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the poison damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Transmute Lava
entries: You choose an area of lava or stone that you can see that fits within a 80-foot cube and is within range, and choose one of the following effects.

entries.name: Melt Rock to Lava
entries: Non-magical rock of any sort in the area becomes an equal volume of thick, flowing lava that remains for the spell's duration.

Each foot that a creature moves through the lava costs 4 feet of movement, and any creature on the ground when you cast the spell takes {@damage 8d8} fire damage and must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes the damage and must make the saving throw when it moves into the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. On a failed save, a creature sinks into the lava and is {@condition restrained}, though it can use an action to end the {@condition restrained} condition on itself by pulling itself free of the lava.

If you cast the spell on a ceiling, the lava falls. Any creature under the lava when it falls must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 4d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The lava cools and hardens back into stone naturally in 10 minutes. If it is submerged in water, or a 5-foot cube takes at least 20 cold damage, it hardens in 1 round.

entries.name: Cool Lava to Rock
entries: Non-magical lava in the area no more than 10 feet deep transforms into hard stone for the spell's duration. Any creature in the lava when it transforms must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, a creature is shunted safely to the surface in an unoccupied space. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition restrained} by the rock. A {@condition restrained} creature, or another creature within reach, can use an action to try to break the rock by succeeding on a DC 25 Strength check or by dealing damage to it. The rock has AC 17 and 50 hit points, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage.

spell.name: Ventriloquism
entries: For the duration, any sounds you make are magically shifted to sound as if they originate from a point within 30 feet of you. When you cast the spell you select the point. You can use an action to change the location of the point to somewhere else within range. If you move out of range of the point, the spell ceases to function until you use an action to select a new point within range.
A creature can use an action to make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC to hear your actual location.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases to 10 minutes.

spell.name: Venomous Sting
entries: Your hand glows green and you strike with the speed of a scorpion. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Vile Slime
entries: Your skin begins to exude a toxic sticky slime that coats the ground around your feet. After you cast this spell, and on each of your turns for the duration as an action, you leave behind a 5-foot wide trail of toxic slime up to 30 feet long wherever you move on that turn.

The slime counts as difficult terrain, and creatures other than you that come in contact with it for the first time on their turn take {@damage 3d8} poison damage and must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition restrained}.

A {@condition restrained} creature takes {@damage 3d8} poison damage at the start of its turns and can use an action to repeat the saving throw to end the condition. When the spell ends, the slime instantly hardens and crumbles away.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell slot, the poison damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Wall of Phantasms
entries: A transparent wall of dim purple light appears on a solid surface at a point you choose within range. The wall can be up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 1 inch thick. It emits dim light out to a range of 30 feet.

When the wall appears, each creature in its area must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
A creature that enters the wall for the first time or ends it's turn within the wall takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage.

Any creature that passes through the wall creates an incorporeal illusory replica of themselves in the nearest unoccupied space. The replica moves along with the target so that it is always adjacent to them, phasing through objects and creatures if necessary. On each of your turns as a bonus action you can command every replica to make a melee spell attack against its target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage.

The wall can only create a single replica for each creature that passes through it. If a creature passes through the wall a second time, the previous replica vanishes and a new one appears in the nearest unoccupied space. A replica can be destroyed by dispel magic.

spell.name: Whispering Wind
entries: You whisper a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The target (and only the target) hears the message, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can reply immediately in a whisper that only you can hear. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.
You can send the message across a distance of up to one mile. If the target of the spell is out of range, the message doesn't arrive.

spell.name: Winter's Curse
entries: You point at a creature that you can see within range and force it to make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the target is {@condition restrained} by icy bands until the end of its next turn as the curse of winter descends upon them. On a success, the spell ends.

Every creature of your choice within a 30-foot radius of the target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is overcome with maddening hatred of the target and must use it's next turn attempting to kill the target as if their life depended on it.
The spell ends if you or your companions harm the target. A creature affected by this spell can repeat the saving throw with advantage if it is harmed by you or your allies.

spell.name: Word of Reckoning
entries: You call down judgement upon one creature that you can see within range. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition restrained} as its body starts to harden. On each of its turns for the duration, the creature must succeed on another saving throw or become {@condition restrained}.

A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned into a pillar of salt and crumbles away. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.

A creature turned to salt by this spell crumbles away immediately, along everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

spell.name: Hold Beast
entries: Choose a beast that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional beast for each slot level above 2nd. The beasts must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Bottomless Pit
entries: You create an illusory bottomless pit on the ground in a 40-foot square within range. Creatures that enter the area for the first time or start their turn there must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a target is {@condition prone}, {@condition incapacitated}, and it's movement is 0 as it believes it is falling endlessly. On a successful save, the target sees through the illusion and can move through the area normally. A creature can also make an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to see through the illusion.
A target can repeat the saving throw with advantage if they take damage. Creatures immune to charms are immune to this effect.

spell.name: Liara's Find Familiar

m.text: 10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier

entries: You gain the service of a familiar, an animal of your choice with which you form a magical bond. You can choose any Small or smaller beast of CR 1/8 or less. The familiar has the statistics of the chosen beast, though its intelligence score increases to a minimum of 10 and its type changes to a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice). You can't have more than one familiar at a time.

Your familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it acts on your initiative. A familiar can't attack, unless you forgo one of your attacks when you take the Attack action to allow your familiar to make one attack of its own.

Your familiar’s hit point maximum changes to be equal to half your hit point maximum (rounded up), unless its normal hit point maximum is higher. Its hit die changes to a {@dice d8}, and its hit die total equals half your hit die total (rounded up).

Your familiar uses your proficiency bonus, rather than its own. It is proficient in all saving throws, and in addition to areas where it normally uses its proficiency bonus, your familiar also adds your proficiency bonus to its AC. If your familiar is subjected to an effect that forces it to make a saving throw to take half damage, it instead takes no damage on a successful save and half damage on a failed save.
A familiar can always speak with animals of its own kind or those similar to it as if under the Speak with Animals spell. For example, a rat could speak with other rodents or a hawk with other birds.

If the familiar dies you must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take two levels of {@condition exhaustion}, taking one level on a successful save. You can cast this spell again to restore it to life, even if you do not have any part of its body.

While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

As an action, you can temporarily dismiss your familiar. It disappears into a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher (you can still cast it as a ritual), you can make a willing Imp, Pseudodragon, or Quasit into your familiar. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can make a willing Dragon Wyrmling into your familiar. Creatures willingly bound to you obey your commands, but can choose to leave at any time.

spell.name: Vibrancy
entries: You touch a willing creature and imbue it with an overflowing burst of positive energy. The target gains {@dice 8d12 + 50} temporary hit points that last for the duration.

spell.name: Aspect of the Phoenix
entries: Your form becomes writhing flames. You gain resistance to fire damage. As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. All creatures within 10 feet of your teleportation destination must a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 4d8} fire damage. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage.

spell.name: Venomous Gale
entries: You blast forth a noxious gale of wind that leaves a sticky green poison in a line 30-feet long and 5-feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. On a failed save, a target also has disadvantage on saving throws against poison for the duration. Any spell that ends the {@condition poisoned} condition ends this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Jennia's Find the Path

m.text: a set of divinatory tools—such as bones, ivory sticks, cards, teeth, or carved runes—worth 100 gp

entries: This spell allows you to find the shortest, most direct physical route to a specified destination, be it the way into or out of a locale. If you name a destination on another plane of existence, a destination that moves, or a destination that isn't specific the spell fails. For example, "a green dragon's lair" would fail, but "Tajenac the green dragon's lair" wouldn't.
For the duration, as long as you are on the same plane of existence as the destination, you know how far it is and in what direction it lies.

While you are traveling there, you automatically know the exact path to follow or physical actions to take to reach the destination by the shortest route. For example, the spell enables the caster to sense the existence of trip wires or the password to bypass a glyph of warding. The spell ends when the destination is reached, the caster's concentration is broken, or the duration expires, whichever comes first. The spell's effect does not predict or allow for the actions of creatures along the route. For example, you would detect a tripwire, but not an ambush.

spell.name: Discern Location
entries: Describe or name a creature that you have seen, or an object that you have touched. You instantly learn that creature or object's location and how to get there. Nothing short of a mind blank spell or the direct intervention of a deity, keeps you from learning this information. The spell also reveals the name of the creature or object’s location (place, name, business name, building name, or the like), community, county (or similar political division), country, continent, and the plane of existence where the target lies.

spell.name: Antimagic Zone

m.text: gemstones or gemstone dust worth at least 50,000gp that is consumed by the spell

entries: A 40-foot-radius {@condition invisible} sphere of antimagic comes into existence at a point you choose within range. This area is divorced from the magical energy that suffuses the multiverse. Within the sphere, spells can't be cast, summoned creatures disappear, and even magic items become mundane.

Spells and other magical effects, except those created by an artifact or a deity, are suppressed in the sphere and can't protrude into it. A slot expended to cast a suppressed spell is consumed. While an effect is suppressed, it doesn't function, but the time it spends suppressed counts against its duration.

entries.name: Targeted Effects
entries: Spells and other magical effects, such as magic missile and charm person, that target a creature or an object in the sphere have no effect on that target.

entries.name: Areas of Magic
entries: The area of another spell or magical effect, such as {@spell fireball}, can't extend into the sphere. If the sphere overlaps an area of magic, the part of the area that is covered by the sphere is suppressed. For example, the flames created by a wall of fire are suppressed within the sphere, creating a gap in the wall if the overlap is large enough.

entries.name: Spells
entries: Any active spell or other magical effect on a creature or an object in the sphere is suppressed while the creature or object is in it.

entries.name: Magic Items
entries: The properties and powers of magic items are suppressed in the sphere. For example, a +1 longsword in the sphere functions as a nonmagical longsword.

A magic weapon's properties and powers are suppressed if it is used against a target in the sphere or wielded by an attacker in the sphere. If a magic weapon or a piece of magic ammunition fully leaves the sphere (for example, if you fire a magic arrow or throw a magic spear at a target outside the sphere), the magic of the item ceases to be suppressed as soon as it exits.

entries.name: Magical Travel
entries: Teleportation and planar travel fail to work in the sphere, whether the sphere is the destination or the departure point for such magical travel. A portal to another location, world, or plane of existence, as well as an opening to an extradimensional space such as that created by the rope trick spell, temporarily closes while in the sphere.

entries.name: Creatures and Objects
entries: A creature or object summoned or created by magic temporarily winks out of existence in the sphere. Such a creature instantly reappears once the space the creature occupied is no longer within the sphere.

entries.name: Dispel Magic
entries: Spells and magical effects such as {@spell dispel magic} have no effect on the sphere. Likewise, the spheres created by different {@spell antimagic field} spells don't nullify each other.

spell.name: Liara's Fire Shield

components.m: a bit of phosphorus or a firefly

entries: Thin and wispy flames wreathe your body for the duration, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.
The flames provide you with a warm shield or a chill shield, as you choose. The warm shield grants you resistance to cold damage, and the chill shield grants you resistance to fire damage.

In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack or if you are dealt damage by a creature touching you from any range, the shield erupts with flame. The attacker takes {@damage 4d4} fire damage from a warm shield, or {@damage 4d4} cold damage from a cold shield. If you are physically in contact with another creature (like being {@condition grappled} by them). That creature takes the damage from this spell at the start and end of their turns as long as they are in contact with you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each level above 4th

spell.name: Ferni's Flame Blade
entries: You evoke a fiery blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action.
You can use your action to make two melee spell attacks with the fiery blade. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage.
The flaming blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|2,4,6,8|1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Amanuensis

components.m: books, paper, or parchment which the spell consumes

entries: You cause writing from one object, such as a book, to be copied onto into another book, paper, or parchment. The spell copies 250 words per minute and creates a perfect duplicate of the original. The spell only copies non-magical writing, and ignores illustrations or magical writing, such as spell scrolls or the Illusory Script spell. Blank spaces are left where illustrations or magical writing would be present in the original source. The spell triggers, but does not copy, magical traps present in the source text.
The writing on the target object is copied onto the material used in the casting of the spell. If the material has multiple pages, the spell automatically turns to the next blank page when necessary.

If more pages exist in the target than blank pages are available, the spell copies until it runs out of blank pages. At any time during the spell's duration you may redirect the magic to copy from another target, copy onto a different blank source, or resume a duplication that was interrupted by a shortfall or blank pages. For the duration, if the target object is moved the spell ends.

If the spell is used to copy a spellbook, you must provide the necessary materials as if you were copying by hand. The spell does not translate the copied writing. If you do not understand the original, you have no additional ability to understand the copy.

spell.name: Analyze Dweomer

components.m: a tiny lense made from a ruby or sapphire worth at least 1500 gp

entries: You choose one object or creature that you must study throughout the casting of the spell. You learn any magical properties or abilities the target possesses. If a target creature can cast spells innately or using spell slots, you learn how many it has and what spells it can cast. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any spells or magical properties are affecting the target creature or object, what they are, and how they work. Immediately after casting this spell, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Analyze Portal
entries: You target a fixed portal such as a permanent teleportation circle or an arcane gate, or a space in which a creature has teleported using the dimension door spell or similar magic in the past turn, and extend a magical probe through the extradimensional opening. You instantly learn the direction and distance of the portal’s destination. If the portal leads to another plane of existence, you learn which plane. If the portal’s destination is random or varies, you learn of this fact, but not of every possible destination. You also learn the requirements to use the portal, if any exist.

spell.name: Deathly Torch

components.m: a dead firefly or glow worm

entries: You cause a small, wispy, pale blue flame to spring to life at a point you choose within range that sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. A creature that enters within 10 feet of the flame or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

If you target an undead creature with this spell, or an undead creature touches the flame, the fire envelopes the creature and moves with it. If the undead creature is destroyed before the spell ends, the flame continues to burn in the creature’s space for the duration of the spell, or until another undead touches it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th level spell slot or higher, you can create an additional flame with a 10-foot radius for each slot level above 3rd. A creature in the area of more than one flame can be affected only once.

spell.name: Demand

components.m: a short piece of fine copper wire and a snake’s tongue

entries: You send a short message of twenty-five words or less and suggest a course of activity to magically influence a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect, but still receive and can respond to your message. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act ends the spell.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do.

You can also specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. For example, you might suggest that a knight give her warhorse to the first beggar she meets. If the condition isn't met before the spell expires, the activity isn't performed.

If you or any of your companions damage the target, the spell ends. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn't arrive.

spell.name: Dimensional Lock
entries: You place a ward that blocks all magical travel within a 40-foot radius of a point that you can see within range. For the duration, creatures can't teleport into or out of the area or use portals, such as those created by the gate spell, to enter the area. The spell proofs the area against planar travel, and therefore prevents creatures from accessing or leaving the area by way of the Astral Plane, Ethereal Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, or the plane shift spell.

Summoning spells do not function if either the caster or the point where the summoned creature appears are within the area. The spell does not prevent already summoned creatures from entering the area, or disappearing at the end of the summoning spell however.

spell.name: Force Ram
entries: You send out a ram-like burst of force that emanates from you in a 5-foot wide, 15-foot long line. Creatures within the area must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d8} force damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a target takes half damage and isn’t knocked {@condition prone}. This spell deals double damage to structures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Wall of Iron

m.text: an iron bar and gold dust worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: A flat, vertical, non-magical wall of uniform solid iron springs into existence at a point on a solid surface you choose within range. The wall can be up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 4 inches thick. Alternatively, you can create the wall standing on its end, such that it is 10 feet long and 30 feet high. You can double the length or height of the wall by halving its thickness, to a minimum of 1 inch.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice). The wall’s edges can be shaped such that it can fit perfectly into an available space.

The wall is an object made of iron that can be damaged and thus breached. A 10-foot section of the wall has AC 18, and 60 hit points per inch of thickness and it is resistant to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Reducing a section to 0 hit points destroys it and might cause connected sections to collapse at the DM's discretion.

When you cast this spell, you can select that it not be attached to a solid surface so that it can be tipped over to fall on and crush creatures beneath it. At the start of your next turn, the wall falls randomly in either direction. A creature can use its action to push the wall in one direction rather than letting it fall randomly by succeeding on a DC 25 Strength (Athletics) check. Large or smaller creatures in the area of a falling wall must succeed Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 10d10} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained} by the wall. On a success, a creature can move up to its speed to escape the wall's area. If a creature cannot escape the wall's area using its movement, it takes the damage and is knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained}. Huge or larger creatures automatically succeed on the saving throw.
If you maintain your concentration on this spell for its whole duration, the wall becomes permanent and can't be dispelled. Otherwise, the wall disappears when the spell ends.

spell.name: Dimensional Anchor
entries: A green ribbon of energy leaps from your outstretched hand toward a creature within range. Choose one creature within range to make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the target is enveloped in a shimmering emerald field that blocks magical travel. For the duration, the target cannot use any form of magical portal or teleportation or similar magic. The spell does not block extradimensional forms of perception or attack. The spell does not prevent summoned creatures from disappearing at the end of their duration.

spell.name: Polymorph (Reworked)
entries: This spell transforms a willing creature that you can see within range into a new form. The spell has no effect on a creature with 0 hit points.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target is reduced to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be any beast, dragon, fey, giant, humanoid, monstrosity, ooze, or plant whose challenge rating is 5 or less. The target transforms into an average example of that creature, one without any class levels or the Spellcasting trait. This transformation is one in physical form only. The target's Armor Class, Speed, Strength, Constitution and Dexterity are replaced by those of the chosen creature. The target's type is also changed to that of the chosen creature, and it gains any natural weapon attacks it normally possesses. It does not gain any special abilities (such as a dragon's breath weapon or Frightful Presence), senses, traits, resistances, immunities, magical abilities, multiattack, or spellcasting.
As part of this transformation, the target regains {@dice 4d6} hit points. The creature's current hit points are unchanged when it returns to its original form.

The target retains the benefit of any features from their class, race, or other source and can use them, provided that the new form is physically capable of doing so. The target retains the ability to speak, even if the chosen creature cannot normally speak.

When you cast the spell, you choose whether the target’s equipment falls to the ground, merges into the new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal. The DM determines whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature's shape and size. The target’s equipment doesn't change shape or size to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge into the new form. Equipment that merges has no effect in that state.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the maximum challenge rating increases by 1 and the hit points the target regains increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Beacon
entries: You fix a mental beacon in the minds of up to six creatures of your choice within range. For the duration, the targets always know the distance and direction to the place where you cast the spell. If a target moves to another plane of existence while under the effects of this spell, the spell ends for that target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration of the spell increases by 2 hours for every slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cassadin's Trap

m.text: powdered amber worth at least 25 gp which the spell consumes

entries: "The real trap is overthinking it." You touch a lock, hinge, or other small mechanism and make it appear to be trapped according to all observation. Any magic that is able to detect traps always returns that a trap exists, and any creature that searches the device for a trap finds one. The trap is completely illusory, and nothing happens if the device is used. If two objects under the effect of this spell are brought within 60 feet of each other, one of them is dispelled at random.

spell.name: Phantom Armor
entries: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a semi-tangible set of illusory plate armor and shield appears upon it until the spell ends. The target's AC can't be less than 19, regardless of what it is normally.

spell.name: Seánce

m.text: a focus worth at least 250 gp, and a candle worth at least 25 gp which

entries: You call upon the soul of a deceased creature to communicate. As part of casting this spell, you can target up to four other creatures to include in the casting and converse with the spirit, who must link hands and remain still for the duration of the spell. Calling upon the spirits of the dead can be difficult, or even dangerous. When you cast this spell, the DM makes a secret Spellcasting ability check on your behalf to determine the outcome, which is modified by how well you know the spirit and the sort of physical connections you have to it.

entries.caption: Knowledge of Spirit
rows: You vaguely know of the spirit (a general description)
You know personal details about the spirit (name, occupation, etc.)
A target of the spell knows the spirit well (friend, loved one, etc.)

entries.caption: Connections to Spirit
rows: Location is familiar to the spirit
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like

entries.caption: Outcomes
rows: Nothing happens and the spell fails.
A Chaotic Evil Ghost (50%) or a Dybbuk (50%) appears, bearing the target soul’s likeness.
The ghost of the desired creature appears and can converse with the targets of the spell.

entries: The soul must be free in order to be targeted by this spell. If the creature’s soul is not free, the spell automatically fails. If the soul of the target creature is unwilling to be summoned and communicated with, the check is made at disadvantage.

If a ghost is successfully summoned, it appears in an unoccupied space within range and acts according to its alignment. For the duration of the spell, all creatures included in the casting can converse and interact with the ghost, and must remain still and keep their arms linked. If any creature involved in the spell moves or performs any actions that require its hands before the spell reaches its full duration, the spell ends and the ghost can choose whether to leave or remain. When the spell reaches its full duration, or as an action on your turn, the spell ends the ghost is sent back from whence it came. If the ghost does not wish to leave, it can choose to make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC to break free from the spell.

spell.name: Cancel
entries: You form a sphere of antimagic in your hand. When you see a creature within 60 feet cast or concentrate on a spell, you release the sphere at them in an attempt to interrupt the spell. If the spell is of 2nd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If the spell is of 3rd level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability +2. The DC equals 10 + the spell’s level + the caster's proficiency bonus. On a success, the creature’s spell fails and has no effect.

Since this spell takes an action to cast, you must use it on a spellcaster who is concentrating on a spell or use the Ready action, anticipating that a creature in range will cast a spell or a creature already concentrating on a spell will come in range.
You then release the readied spell using your reaction. You may continue to concentrate on this spell or for longer than 1 round until released at a target or dismissed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus to the ability check increases by one for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Duelist's Etiquette
entries: You touch the ground, and a 30-foot radius of the spell’s area is traced with a faintly glowing line of energy. The spell creates a subtle defensive barrier against magical attacks, causing all damage from spells and summoned creatures that originate in
the area of effect to become nonlethal. A creature brought to 0 hit points from nonlethal spell damage is {@condition unconscious} and stable.

Whenever a creature enters the warded area or is present when the spell is cast, it must consciously choose to accept this restriction, or else the spell ends. If at any time a creature inside the area no longer wishes to abide by the wards, they can spend an action to end the spell.
This spell is primarily used to ensure that spell duels are not fatal, without forcing mages to hold back their strongest powers.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius of the circle increases by 10 feet for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Counterspell

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

entries: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell.  Make an ability check using your spellcasting ability  + 3. The DC equals 10 + the caster's proficiency bonus + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you gain an additional +1 bonus to the ability check for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Dispel Magic
entries: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Make an ability check using your spellcasting ability +3, for each magical effect you know of on the target. For spells, the DC equals 10 + the caster's proficiency bonus + the spell's level. For magical effects, the DC equals the save DC of the effect. On a successful check, the magical effect of on the target ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you gain an additional +1 bonus to the ability check for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Kal's Ability Booster

components.m: a pendant of a middle finger pointed in the general direction of WotC headquarters

entries: You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose one of the following effects; the target gains that effect until the spell ends.

entries.name: Bear's Endurance
entries: The affected creature gains greater vitality and stamina. The spell grants the subject a +2 bonus to Constitution, which adds the usual benefits to hit points, Constitution saves, Constitution checks, and so forth.

entries.name: Bull's Strength
entries: The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +2 bonus to Strength, adding the usual benefits to melee attack rolls, melee damage rolls, and other uses of the Strength modifier.

entries.name: Cat's Grace
entries: The transmuted creature becomes more graceful, agile, and coordinated. The spell grants a +2 bonus to Dexterity, adding the usual benefits to AC, and other uses of the Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Eagle's Splendor
entries: The transmuted creature becomes more poised, articulate, and personally forceful. The spell grants a +2 bonus to Charisma, adding the usual benefits to Charisma based skill checks and other uses of the Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Fox's Cunning
entries: The transmuted creature becomes smarter. The spell grants a +2 bonus to Intelligence, adding the usual benefits to Intelligence based skill checks and other uses of the Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Owl's Wisdom
entries: The transmuted creature becomes wiser. The spell grants a +2 bonus to Wisdom, adding the usual benefit to Wisdom related skills.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can add a second option from this spell's effects to a creature already effected by the spell. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can add a third option from this spell's effects to a creature already effected by the spell.

spell.name: Discern Lies
entries: For the duration, you know if any creature within 30 feet of you deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie. You do not need to know the language a creature is speaking to determine that it is lying. This spell does not reveal the truth, uncover unintentional inaccuracies, or necessarily reveal evasions.

spell.name: Baleful Polymorph
entries: You attempt to turn one creature that you can see within range into the form of any CR 0 beast. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is transformed. On a successful save, the creature isn't affected. The spell has no effect on a creature with 0 hit points.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target is reduced to 0 hit points or dies. If the new form would prove fatal to the creature (for example, if you polymorphed a landbound target into a fish, or an airborne target into a toad), the target gains advantage on the saving throw.

A creature transformed by this spell must make another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails its saves three times, the transformation lasts until dispelled or the target dies. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.

The target's game statistics, excluding mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast.
