It retains its hit points, alignment, personality, and the ability to understand language. If the transformation becomes permanent, the creature’s mental ability scores and hit points are replaced by those of its new form. The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

spell.name: Detect Scrying

components.m: a tiny mirror and a brass hearing trumpet

entries: For the duration, you sense any attempts to observe you by divination, such as the clairvoyance or scrying spell or similar magic, or using a crystal ball or other scrying device.

Make an opposed spellcasting ability check against the creature attempting to scry on you. On a success, you receive a brief visual image of the target. If the scrying attempt originates within 120 feet of you, you also know its location.

spell.name: Tilly's Dispelling Screen

m.text: a sheet of fine crystal worth 500 gp

entries: An opaque shimmering screen of violet energy springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1 foot thick. It lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, for every spell or magical effect on any creature or object that isn’t being worn or carried in its area, make a spellcasting ability check + 5. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level + the caster’s proficiency bonus. On a successful check, the spell ends. Spells and other magical effects can't extend through the screen or be cast through it. You also make this spellcasting ability check whenever a creature moves into the wall’s area for the first time on its turn. A disintegrate spell destroys the wall instantly.

spell.name: Intercede

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 30 feet of you get hit by an attack

entries: You channel your magical power to intervene in an attack against a creature within range. You fly at high speed in a direct line to an unoccupied space beside the target and intercept an attack that was directed toward them, taking the damage for the attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the range increases by 30 feet for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Kal's Greater Ability Booster

components.m: a pendant of a middle finger pointed in the general direction of WotC headquarters

entries: You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose one of the following effects; the target gains that effect until the spell ends.

entries.name: Bear's Endurance
entries: The affected creature gains greater vitality and stamina. The spell grants the subject a +4 bonus to Constitution, which adds the usual benefits to hit points, Constitution saves, Constitution checks, and so forth.

entries.name: Bull's Strength
entries: The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +4 bonus to Strength, adding the usual benefits to melee attack rolls, melee damage rolls, and other uses of the Strength modifier.

entries.name: Cat's Grace
entries: The transmuted creature becomes more graceful, agile, and coordinated. The spell grants a +4 bonus to Dexterity, adding the usual benefits to AC, and other uses of the Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Eagle's Splendor
entries: The transmuted creature becomes more poised, articulate, and personally forceful. The spell grants a +4 bonus to Charisma, adding the usual benefits to Charisma based skill checks and other uses of the Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Fox's Cunning
entries: The transmuted creature becomes smarter. The spell grants a +4 bonus to Intelligence, adding the usual benefits to Intelligence based skill checks and other uses of the Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Owl's Wisdom
entries: The transmuted creature becomes wiser. The spell grants a +4 bonus to Wisdom, adding the usual benefit to Wisdom related skills.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can add a second option from this spell's effects to a creature already effected by the spell. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can add a third option from this spell's effects to a creature already effected by the spell.

spell.name: Liara's Speedy Casting
entries: You imbue yourself with supernatural focus and precision in your spellcasting. For the duration, you can cast any spell that has a casting time of 1 action as 1 bonus action.

spell.name: Bolts of Bedevilment (Banned pending rework)
entries: You create three tiny motes of twinkling purple light in your space. They float in the air and orbit you for the spell's duration. When you cast the spell—and as an action on each of your turns thereafter—you can expend one of the motes, shooting a ray at a creature you choose within 120 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the number of motes created increases by one for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Genesis

m.text: an Amulet of Planes, which the spell consumes, and a specially crafted adamantine rod worth at least 5,000 gp

entries: You create a fixed fluctuation in the density of space by pulling vapors of protomatter from the ethereal plane that warp into a separate, finite plane of existence. Upon casting this spell, a 10-foot diameter circular portal that leads to this fledgeling plane opens at a point you can see within range. The portal disappears after 1 hour, and any creatures or objects inside the plane remain there, as the portal also disappears from the other side.

This plane of existence starts as a sphere with a 30-foot radius. The borders of the plane are composed of an impassable wall of mist. The plane’s radius expands at a rate of 5 feet per day until reaching a maximum of 180 feet. You determine the environment of the plane when you cast the spell, such as ambient light, temperature, water, and the shape and composition of the general terrain. You can also cause natural variations in these conditions, such as to simulate day and night or changing weather. However, this spell does not create life, such as vegetation, nor can it create structures, such as buildings or roads.

The adamantine rod used as a material component for this spell becomes magically attuned to the new plane of existence, and becomes that plane’s ‘control rod’. Each time you cast this spell, you can create a new plane using a new adamantine rod, or alter and expand a plane created with a previous casting of this spell using the same control rod used in the plane’s original creation. If the control rod is destroyed, the plane rapidly destabilizes and collapses in on itself, spilling its contents across the Astral Plane.

Each time you choose to alter or expand an existing plane, the plane’s radius expands by up to 60 feet at a rate of 5 feet per day. Any changes to the plane’s environment occurs gradually over a period of 30 days, and may destroy structures or vegetation that rely on existing conditions.

The focus and stress involved in casting this spell weakens you. After enduring that stress, each time you cast a spell until you finish a long rest, you take {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage per level of that spell. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. Additionally, you take a −4 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. Every time you finish a long rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it disappears.

spell.name: Status
entries: You place a magical sensor upon a creature you touch. For the duration, you know the direction and distance to the target, and are aware of its general health and any conditions that affect it. If the target moves to another plane of existence, or if it dies, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target two additional creatures for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shrink Object

m.text: a pinch of powdered iron and diamonds worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You cause a non-magical Medium or smaller object to shrink down into a clothlike patch. The patch is a 1-foot square and weighs 1 pound. As an action, you can rip the patch, ending the spell and causing the object to return to its original form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 6th level spell slot, the target object can be of Large size. When you cast this spell using a 8th level spell slot, the target object can be of Huge size.

spell.name: Translocation Trick
entries: You target a creature of your choice that you can see within range and swap places and appearances with them. The target must be of the same size and basic shape as you; if you’re bipedal, so too must be the target. An unwilling target can make a Charisma saving throw, and if it succeeds, it is unaffected by this spell.

For the duration, you take on the physical appearance of the target, including height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any, though none of your statistics change. The target is also changed in a similar manner to take on your appearance. When you cast the spell, you can choose for yourself or the target to not undergo this change.
At any time before the spell ends, you can use an action to force the target to make another Charisma saving throw if it is within range. On a failure, you swap places again.

spell.name: Wail of the Banshee
entries: You emit a horrifying scream that chills living creatures to their soul. Each creature within 60 feet must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the target is {@condition frightened}.

A creature {@condition frightened} by this spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the condition ends. If it fails its saves three times, it dies. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

spell.name: Matilda's Minor Gateway
entries: "Introducing Matilda Everdawn’s latest creation, Matilda’s Minor Gateway! Stable teleportation gateways are a tricky business, but with Matilda’s help, even a mediocre spellcaster like you can open durable gateways with ease. Just pay the passage fee and you can have a perfect little wormhole to reach wherever you need. Is that trap lever just out of reach? Are those pesky orcs around the corner a bit too intimidating to face directly? With Matilda’s Minor Gateway, everything is close at hand!"

You create linked teleportation portals that remain open for the duration. Choose two points that you can see, one point within 10 feet of you and one point within 60 feet of you. A circular portal, 1 foot in diameter, opens floating at each point. If the portal would open in a space occupied by a creature, the spell fails, and the casting is lost.

The portals are two-dimensional faintly glowing rings that show the destination area, hovering in the air facing a direction and orientation you choose. A ring is usable only from one side (your choice), which is the side that functions as a portal. The nonportal side is obscured by an opaque wall of mist that blocks vision.

Any creature or object entering the portal exits from the other portal as if the two were adjacent to each other; passing through a portal from the nonportal side has no effect. The destination area is visible through the gateway. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to insert another 5 gold pieces into the portal. The gold pieces disappear and cause the linked portal to change its position and orientation to anywhere else within range.

spell.name: Bloodletter

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You cause black necromantic spikes and blades to temporarily sprout from the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and the target suffers a necrotic wound. Unless it receives the benefits of a lesser restoration spell or similar magic, this creature cannot regain hit points for the duration, and it takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage at the start of your next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Blightwell’s Bridge Breaker
entries: You touch a weapon that deals bludgeoning damage. Until the spell ends, that weapon is considered magical and deals double damage to objects and structures.

spell.name: Oaken Roots
entries: You touch a willing creature and cause magical roots to sprout from its hands and feet. For the duration, the target adds your spellcasting modifier to any ability check or saving throw it makes to avoid being moved against its will or knocked {@condition prone}, grapple another creature, or avoid being disarmed.

spell.name: Helping Hand
entries: A spectral, floating hand appears in an unoccupied space within range. When you cast the spell, you specify a creature by name or by physical description such as race, gender, and general appearance. The hand immediately streaks off in search of a subject that matches the description. The amount of time it takes to find the subject depends on how far away the creature is.

Once the hand finds a target that matches the description, it beckons for that creature to follow it. If the creature does so, the hand hovers 10 feet in front of the target and guides it in your direction along the most direct feasible route. Once the hand leads the target back to you, the spell ends.

If the target does not follow the hand, the hand continues to beckon for the duration of the spell. If more than one target matching your description is within 5 miles of you, the hand locates the closest creature. If that target refuses to follow the hand, it does not seek out a second target.
After 4 hours of searching, if the hand has found no target matching your description, it gives up and returns to you in 10 minutes, displaying an outstretched palm, and the spell ends.

The hand has a flight speed of 240 feet and is {@condition invisible} to anyone except you and the target. The target is magically able to perceive the hand, even if it is normally incapable of sight. A solid barrier blocks the hand’s movement, but the hand can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter. The hand cannot travel more than 5 miles from the location where you cast the spell.

spell.name: Tilly's Phantasmal Force
entries: You craft an illusion that takes root in the mind of a creature that you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you create a phantasmal object, creature, or other visible phenomenon of your choice that is no larger than a 10-foot cube and that is perceivable only to the target for the duration. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
The phantasm includes sound, temperature, and other stimuli, also evident only to the creature.

The target can use its action to examine the phantasm with an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If the check succeeds, the target realizes that the phantasm is an illusion, and the spell ends.

While a target is affected by the spell, the target treats the phantasm as if it were real. The target rationalizes any illogical outcomes from interacting with the phantasm. For example, a target attempting to walk across a phantasmal bridge that spans a chasm falls once it steps onto the bridge. If the target survives the fall, it still believes that the bridge exists and comes up with some other explanation for its fall—it was pushed, it slipped, or a strong wind might have knocked it off.

An affected target is so convinced of the phantasm's reality that it can even take damage from the illusion. A phantasm created to appear as a creature can attack the target. Similarly, a phantasm created to appear as fire, a pool of acid, or lava can burn the target. Each round on your turn, the phantasm can deal {@damage 1d6} psychic damage to the target if it is in the phantasm's area or within 5 feet of the phantasm, provided that the illusion is of a creature or hazard that could logically deal damage, such as by attacking. The target perceives the damage as a type appropriate to the illusion.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the illusion affects and is perceivable by one additional creature for each level above 2nd. When affecting multiple creatures, the phantasm can interact with each creature individually while maintaining the validity of the illusion, but the nature of the phantasm must be the same.

spell.name: Greater Teleport
entries: This spell instantly transports you and up to 16 willing creatures of your choice that you can see within range, or a single object that you can see within range, to a destination you select. If you target an object, it must be able to fit entirely inside a 10-foot cube, and it can't be held or carried by an unwilling creature.

The destination you choose must be known to you and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. You need not have seen the destination, but in that case you must have at least a reliable description of the place to which you are teleporting. If you attempt to teleport with insufficient information (or with misleading information), you disappear and simply reappear in your original location.

spell.name: Arcane Conduit

m.text: diamond dust worth 5000gp which the spell consumes

entries: As you cast the spell, you create a 10-foot-diameter circle on the ground or other horizontal surface that links your location to a destination. The destination you choose must be known to you and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. You need not have seen the destination, but in that case you must have at least a reliable description of the destination. If you attempt to cast the spell with insufficient information (or with misleading information), the spell fails although the materials are still consumed.
Any creature who enters the circle is instantly teleported to the chosen destination. Once you designate the destination for the circle, you can’t change it.
The circle is nearly {@condition invisible} and requires a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to be found.

spell.name: Lesser Teleport
entries: This spell instantly transports you and up to two willing creatures that you touch, to a destination you select within 500 miles of you. If you target an object, it must be able to fit entirely inside a 5-foot cube, and it can't be held or carried by an unwilling creature.

You must have some clear idea of the location and layout of the destination, and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. The clearer your mental image, the more likely the teleportation works. Areas of strong physical or magical energy may make teleportation more hazardous or even impossible.
The DM rolls {@dice d100} and consults the table.
“Very familiar” is a place where you have been very often and where you feel at home.

“Studied carefully” is a place you know well, either because you can currently see it, you’ve been there often, or you have used other means (such as scrying) to study the place for at least one hour.
“Seen casually” is a place that you have seen more than once but with which you are not very familiar.
“Viewed once” is a place that you have seen once, possibly using magic.
Description is a place whose location and appearance you know through someone else's description, perhaps from a map.

“False destination” is a place that does not truly exist or if you are teleporting to an otherwise familiar location that no longer exists as such or has been so completely altered as to no longer be familiar to you. When traveling to a false destination, roll {@dice 2d100} and keep the lowest to obtain results on the table since there is no real destination for you to hope to arrive at or even be off target from.
On Target - You appear where you want to be.

Off Target - You appear safely a random distance away from the destination in a random direction. Distance off target is {@dice 1d10 × 1d10} percent of the distance that was to be traveled. The direction off target is determined randomly

Similar Area - You wind up in an area that’s visually or thematically similar to the target area. Generally, you appear in the closest similar place within range. If no such area exists within the spell’s range, the spell simply fails instead.

Mishap - The spell's unpredictable magic results in a difficult journey. Each teleporting creature (or the target object) takes {@damage 1d10} force damage, and the DM rerolls on the table to see where you wind up (multiple mishaps can occur, dealing damage each time). For these rerolls, roll {@dice 2d100} and keep the lowest result.

spell.name: Syletza's Teleport
entries: This spell instantly transports you and up to eight willing creatures of your choice that you can see within range, or a single object that you can see within range, to a destination you select. If you target an object, it must be able to fit entirely inside a 10-foot cube, and it can't be held or carried by an unwilling creature.

You must have some clear idea of the location and layout of the destination, and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. The clearer your mental image, the more likely the teleportation works. Areas of strong physical or magical energy may make teleportation more hazardous or even impossible.

For these rerolls, roll {@dice 2d100} and keep the lowest result.

spell.name: Seize Portal

time.condition: which you take when a creature within range uses teleportation or interplanar travel

entries: You grab ahold of the dimensional rift created when a creature teleports and attempt to chase them through the portal. Make an opposed spellcasting ability check against the caster of the triggering spell. If the target does not currently have their reaction, you automatically succeed. On a success, this spell instantly transports you to the same relative destination as the creature who used teleportation. You appear wherever the portal took the creature at the same distance you were when you cast the spell. For example, if you were 30 feet south of a creature when it teleported, you appear 30 feet south of the destination. If the space where you would appear is occupied, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell.

spell.name: Ironwood

m.text: a wooden rod from a tree over a century old and a powdered topaz worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a wooden object weighing 50 pounds or less, or a Small or smaller creature composed primarily of wood, and magically reinforce it with the strength and durability of steel. For the duration, the target is as heavy and strong as an equivalent object of steel (its weight is multiplied by ten). A wooden creature affected by this spell gains a +2 bonus to AC and has its hit point maximum doubled for the duration. Wood affected by this spell loses its vulnerability to fire and does not burn. A wooden sword affected by this spell would act just like a steel one, or wooden plate armor would provide the same protections as steel plate.
If you cast this spell on the same object every day for 30 days, it becomes permanent.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the weight limit of an object increases to 75 pounds or the size limit of a creature increases to Medium. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the weight limit of an object increases to 100 pounds or the size limit of a creature increases to Large.

spell.name: Glassteel
entries: You touch an object or area that fits within a 2-foot cube and cause it to take on the transparency of fine glass. For the duration, you can see through the affected material as if it were made of glass. The normal properties of the object do not change, only the transparency.

You have advantage on ability checks made to conceal objects affected by this spell. Discerning the actual material of an object or area affected by this spell requires a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC.
If you cast this spell on the same object every day for 30 days, it lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Boreal Wind
entries: A line of freezing wind 120 feet long and 15 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. When you cast the spell, and at the start of each of your turns for the duration, each creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 5d6} cold damage, halved on a successful save. Each creature that starts its turn in the line or enters it for the first time on its turn must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the line.
Any creature in the line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It also extinguishes protected flames, such as those of lanterns. Large fires, such as bonfires or a house fire that are in the spell's area have a 50% chance to be extinguished by the wind at the start of each of your turns.
As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the line blasts from you.

spell.name: Rigur's Obedient Avalanche
entries: You bring forth a surging avalanche of ice and snow from the air and bend it to your command. The area of the avalanche consists of ten 20-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must share at least half of one face with another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Strength saving throw or be buried by the avalanche. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 4d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a Large or smaller creature that fails the save is knocked {@condition prone} and becomes {@condition restrained} under a 5-foot mound of snow.

The avalanche leaves behind a drift of snow 5 feet deep that is difficult terrain until cleared or the snow melts. A creature {@condition restrained} under the snow cannot breathe, and can use its action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check with a DC of 15 plus 1 for each foot of snow the creature is buried under. On a success, it frees itself. Each 5-foot-cube portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand or 15 points of fire damage to melt.
The snow melts after 10 minutes, or 5 minutes in a hot environment, or only 1 minute in an extremely hot environment.

spell.name: Aurethia's Death Blizzard
entries: You bring down a howling magical blizzard that feeds on life and warmth down on a point on the ground that you can see within range. The blizzard is a 50-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder. Until the spell ends, you can use your action to move the blizzard up to 50 feet in any direction along the ground.

The howling winds deafen creatures within the area. The area is considered difficult terrain and is heavily obscured. A creature must make a Strength saving throw if it flies into the blizzard for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there flying. On a failed save, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}. Ranged weapon attacks in the area are impossible. The wind and snow count as a severe distraction for the purposes of maintaining concentration on spells. Finally, gusts of strong wind (ranging from 20 to 50 miles per hour) automatically disperse fog, mists, and similar phenomena in the area, whether mundane or magical.

When the blizzard appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} cold damage and {@damage 5d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw whenever it ends its turn in the blizzard.

A target is dissolved if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points. A dissolved creature is reduced to a pile of fine white snow that is immediately swept away in the blizzard, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

spell.name: Ease of Breath
entries: You imbue up to four willing creatures within range with the ability to survive in thin and freezing air. Until the spell ends, each target is acclimated to freezing air and high altitudes, including altitudes over 20,000 feet. The amount of time a creature can hold its breath is also doubled for the duration.

spell.name: Evergreen

m.text: a specially prepared branch of pine worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell imbues magical heat upon the land and vitality upon plants within a specific area. As part of casting this spell, you plant the branch of pine used as a material component in the ground at your feet. All normal plants within a 60-foot radius of that point gain immunity to cold damage for the duration of the spell, or until the branch of pine is removed. For the duration, the branch is immune to the effects of time and weather.
If you cast this spell every 10 days for one year in the same location, the spell lasts until it is dispelled, or until the branch of pine is removed.

spell.name: Entomb
entries: You attempt to entrap one creature that you can see within range in a pillar of ice. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition restrained} as ice begins to rapidly form around its body. On a successful save, the creature isn't affected.

A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell must make another Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails its saves three times, the spell ends and it is completely encased in a permanent pillar of ice. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.

A creature that is completely encased in ice is {@condition incapacitated} and cannot breathe. The ice pillar can be broken to free the creature. The pillar has AC 15 and 100 hit points, and it is immune to cold damage and vulnerable to fire damage.

spell.name: Shape Snow
entries: You touch an area of snow that fits within a 10-foot cube and form it into any shape that suits your purpose. So, for example, you could raise a snowbank for cover, sculpt a snow statue or idol, or open a 10-foot long tunnel through deep snow. You could also raise snowy barriers around a door or house to prevent passage in or out, or clog a chimney or structure with snow. The snow is just sturdy enough to maintain its shape, but cannot be formed into objects such as weapons, and fine detail is not possible. This spell also cannot affect solid ice in any form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the size of the area you can shape increases by 5 feet for every slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Freezing Gaze
entries: Your eyes become wintry tombs that destroy the spark of life in those that meet your stare. When you cast the spell, and as an action on each of your turns for the duration, one creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be plunged into a deathly trance.

A frozen creature is {@condition incapacitated} and spends each of their turns doing nothing but staring ahead vacantly. At the end of each minute, the affected creature may repeat the saving throw, ending the condition on a success. An affected creature may repeat the saving throw with advantage if it takes damage or if another creature uses its action to attempt to shake or slap them to their senses.
Undead and creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by this spell.

spell.name: Globe of Elemental Protection

components.m: a glass or crystal bead that shatters when the spell ends

entries: An opaque swirling barrier of elemental chaos springs into existence in a 20-foot radius around you and moves with you for the duration. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder. The barrier's appearance is determined by the elemental you choose (swirling mist for cold or smoke for fire).

The barrier intercepts and absorbs damaging spells of the chosen damage type. For the duration, any spell of 3rd level or lower that deals damage of the chosen type cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells.

Creatures within the barrier are also granted full cover from any ambient nonmagical effects that deal damage of the chosen type (such as freezing air or toxic gas), though physical materials that deal damage on contact (such as lava, hailstones, or a {@condition poisoned} blade) can pass through normally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the barrier blocks damaging spells of one level higher for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Drifting Glaciers
entries: You create four glaciers of ice centered on points you can see on the ground within range. Each glacier is a 20-foot cube that slides along the ground at your command. If a creature occupies a space where a glacier appears, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 4d6} cold damage as it is moved to the outside of the glacier and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, the damage is halved and the creature is not knocked {@condition prone}.

On each of your turns for the duration, you can use a bonus action to command each of the glaciers within range to move in a straight line along the ground up to 30 feet. If a glacier would move through a creature's space, the creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed by the glacier to the end of its movement. On a success, the glacier is stopped.

If a creature is pushed by a glacier and collides with a solid surface or object larger than itself, it takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 5 feet the glacier moves and is {@condition restrained} until the start of your next turn. If it collides with another glacier, the creature takes damage for the distance moved by each glacier.
The glaciers are supernaturally cold. Each creature that enters within 5 feet of a glacier for the first time on its turn or ends its turn there takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage.
In water, the glaciers float with the bottom 15 feet of the cube submerged.
Each glacier has AC 15, 150 hit points, immunity to cold, and vulnerability to fire damage. If a glacier is reduced to 0 hit points, it crumbles away and is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the hit point maximum of each glacier increases by 50 for every slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Heartfreeze

components.m: a strip of dried humanoid sinew

entries: You reach out towards a creature that you can see within range and attempt to freeze its beating heart within its chest. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} as their heart begins to freeze. On a success, the target takes {@damage 8d8} cold damage and stops making saving throws.

At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target gains two levels of {@condition exhaustion}. On a success, the target gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

If the target receives magical healing, the caster can make a DC 16 spellcasting ability check. On a success, the target stops making saving throws and loses any levels of {@condition exhaustion} gained from this spell.
This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the DC of the spellcasting ability check increases by 2 for every slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Glacial Fortress

m.text: a blue glass figurine crafted in the shape of a castle worth at least 2,000 gp, and a sapphire worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: A fortress of glacial ice erupts from a circular area of ground of your choice that you can see within range. The area is a 60-foot radius, and it must not have any buildings or other structures on it. Any creatures in the area are harmlessly lifted up as the fortress rises.

The fortress rests atop a solid platform of ice 10 feet thick and is rimmed by a slope of slick ice 10-feet wide and 10-feet tall. The slope counts as difficult terrain, and climbing the icy slope without falling requires a successful Dexterity ability check against your spell save DC.

The fortress is encircled by a sheer wall of ice with a 50-foot radius that runs up against the outer slope of ice and creates an enclosed area. Each wall is 5 feet thick and is composed of panels that are 10 feet wide and 20 feet tall. Each panel is contiguous with two other panels. You can place up to four ice doors in the fortress's outer wall. Each doorway is a 10-foot wide, 3-foot thick, set of double doors that is magically locked by the arcane lock spell and has an 10-foot wide ice stairway leading up the outer slope.

A central tower stands inside the enclosed area. The tower has a circular base that is a 20-foot radius, and it has five floors with 10-foot-high ceilings. Each of the floors can be divided into as many rooms as you like, provided each room is at least 5 feet on each side. The floors of the tower are connected by ice staircases, its walls are 1 foot thick, and interior rooms can have ice doors or open archways as you choose. The keep is furnished and decorated however you like, but all the furnishings and decorations are composed of ice or snow. Furnishings and other objects created by this spell crumble to powdery snow if removed from the fortress.

When you cast the spell, you can choose for the fortress to not be attached to the ground. While inside the fortress, as an action you can direct it to move. The fortress drifts slowly along the ground in a straight line with a speed of 10 feet, and can travel up to 24 miles a day. The fortress continues to move in a straight line until you issue another command or it encounters a Huge or larger obstacle. You can use your action on each of your turns to change the fortress' direction or command it to stop. The fortress can only move through open terrain and cannot travel up slopes steeper than a gentle hill. Creatures in the fortress' path are harmlessly pushed along with it. A creature can use its action to make a Strength ability check against your spell save DC to stop the fortress, or push it in a direction if it is currently immobile.

You can also cast this spell on the surface of a body of water. When you do so, the underneath of the fortress is supported by a 60-foot radius hemisphere of ice. You can command the floating fortress to move just as you would on land, though currents and rough seas may affect your movement, at the DM's discretion.
A staff of ten {@condition invisible} servants obeys any command given to them by creatures you designate when you cast the spell. Each servant functions as if created by the unseen servant spell.

The walls and tower are all made of ice that can be damaged. Each 10-foot-by-10-foot section of ice has AC 13 and 50 hit points per foot of thickness. It is immune to cold, poison, and psychic damage. Reducing a section of ice to 0 hit points destroys it and might cause connected sections to buckle and collapse at the DM's discretion. Unless a section is destroyed, it regains 5 hit points at the start of each of your turns while in below freezing temperatures. Cold damage heals the structures by a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt. In temperatures above freezing, the fortress rapidly melts as it takes 1 fire damage at the start of each of your turns.
After 7 days or when you cast this spell somewhere else, the fortress harmlessly crumbles and sinks back into the ground, leaving any creatures that were inside it safely on the ground.
Casting this spell on the same fortress once every day for a year makes the fortress permanent.

spell.name: Rigur's Ice Skates
entries: You touch a creature and cause its feet to be encased in a magical sheath of ice until the spell ends. For the duration, the target ignores difficult terrain created by ice or snow, its speed increases by 60 feet, and its long jump distance is tripled while walking on snowy or icy surfaces. The target can even skate up, down, or across vertical surfaces of ice. If the target ends its turn while not on a horizontal surface, it falls unless it has other means of holding onto the surface.
While moving across snowy or icy terrain, the target can travel 9 miles in an hour, or 12 miles at a fast pace.

If the target takes any damage, it must succeed on a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check with a DC of 10 or half the damage taken (whichever is higher) or fall {@condition prone}. If the target takes fire damage, the spell ends and the target falls {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Rigur's Sudden Iceberg
entries: A massive chunk of ice materializes in the air and crashes to the ground, crushing things and exploding on impact in a 60-foot radius centered on a point on the ground you choose within range. Each creature within the impact area must make a Dexterity saving throw or take damage based upon how close it is to the center of the radius.

Creatures within a 20-foot radius of the center take {@damage 12d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 12d8} cold damage and are knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained} under a 10-foot drift of snow and ice on a failed save. On a successful save, the damage is halved.

Creatures between 20 feet and 40 feet from the center take {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 10d8} cold damage and are knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained} under a 5-foot drift of snow and ice on a failed save. On a successful save, the damage is halved and the creature is not {@condition restrained}.

Creatures between 40 feet and 60 feet from the center take {@damage 8d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 8d8} cold damage and are knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. On a successful save, the damage is halved and the creature is not knocked {@condition prone}.

The iceberg can appear up to 500 feet above the point you choose, striking any creatures in its path as it falls and forcing them to make a Dexterity saving throw in the same way it affects creatures on the ground.

The iceberg leaves behind a drift of snow that is difficult terrain until cleared or the snow melts. The snow within a 20-foot radius of the center is 10 feet deep, while the snow between 20 feet and 40 feet of the center is 5 feet deep. A creature {@condition restrained} under the snow cannot breathe, and can use its action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check with a DC of 15 plus 1 for each foot of snow the creature is buried under. On a success, it frees itself. Each 5-foot-cube portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand or 15 points of fire damage to melt.
The snow melts after 10 minutes, or 5 minutes in a hot environment, or only 1 minute in an extremely hot environment.

spell.name: Hibernate

m.text: a powder composed of diamond, emerald, ruby, and sapphire dust worth at least 250 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: By means of this spell, a willing creature can be put into a state of suspended animation. The target doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. If the target is diseased or {@condition poisoned} when you cast the spell, or becomes diseased or {@condition poisoned} while under the spell's effect, the disease and poison have no effect until the spell ends.

You can set a condition for the spell to end early. The condition can be anything you choose, but it must occur or be visible within 1 mile of the target. Examples include "when spring arrives" or "when a creature comes within 10 feet." This spell also ends if the target takes any damage.

spell.name: Rigur's Instant Igloo

components.m: a snow knife and a blue glass bead

entries: A 6-foot radius snow igloo of fine construction with a packed snow floor springs into existence centered on the point where you cast the spell.

Three creatures of Medium size can fit inside the igloo with you. The igloo is breached and collapses if its area includes a larger creature or more than three other Medium creatures. The igloo has one three-foot tall, three-foot long tunnel that serves as an entrance. The entrance is obscured by a magical veil of mist that blocks vision and all weather conditions.

The igloo is magically impervious to all weather conditions, as well as arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles (boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, can damage the igloo). If the igloo is damaged and breached, it instantly collapses and the spell ends. The igloo has AC 8, 10 hit points, immunity to cold and vulnerability to fire damage. If the atmosphere outside the igloo is above freezing, it begins melting and loses 1 hit point each minute until it collapses.

The atmosphere inside the igloo is always clean, dry, and just above freezing, regardless of the weather outside. Inside the igloo is a magical light that you can command to become bright, dim, or dark throughout the duration.

spell.name: Meld into Ice
entries: You step into an ice object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, melding yourself and all the equipment you carry with the ice for the duration. Using your movement, you step into the ice at a point you can touch. Nothing of your presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by non-magical senses.

While merged with the ice, you can't see what occurs outside it, and any Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with disadvantage. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while merged in the ice. You can use your movement to leave the ice where you entered it, which ends the spell. You otherwise can't move.

Minor physical damage to the ice doesn't harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage to you. The ice's complete destruction (or transmutation into a different substance) expels you and deals 50 bludgeoning damage to you. If expelled, you fall {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered.

spell.name: Move Snow and Ice

components.m: a snow knife and a small bag filled with snow and ice

entries: Choose an area of snow or ice no larger than 40 feet on a side within range. You can reshape snow or ice in the area in any manner you choose for the duration. This spell does not violently break the surface of snow or ice. Instead, it creates waves or troughs with glacier-like fluidity until the desired result is achieved.

You can raise or lower the area's elevation, create or fill in a trench, erect or flatten a wall, or form a pillar. The extent of any such changes can't exceed half the area's largest dimension. So, if you affect a 40-foot square, you can create a pillar up to 20 feet high, raise or lower the square's elevation by up to 20 feet, dig a trench up to 20 feet deep, and so on. It takes 10 minutes for these changes to complete.
At the end of every 10 minutes you spend concentrating on the spell, you can choose a new area of terrain to affect.
Because the terrain's transformation occurs slowly, creatures in the area can't usually be trapped or injured by the ground's movement.
Objects and structures shift to accommodate the new terrain. If the way you shape the terrain would make a structure unstable, it might collapse.
Similarly, this spell doesn't directly affect plant growth. The moved earth carries any plants along with it.

spell.name: Numbing Sphere

components.m: a bit of water, a pinch of flour, and a dusting of powdered ivory

entries: A 5-foot-diameter sphere of solid blue-white fog appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d4} cold damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it can't take reactions until the start of your next turn. On a successful save the damage is halved and it suffers no other effects.

When the sphere appears, and on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere, and the sphere stops moving this turn.

When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide. You cannot control the sphere while it is outside of the spell's range. The sphere freezes liquids it comes in contact with, allowing it to roll over liquid normally and leaving a path of ice.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Winter Walk
entries: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to pass through ice or snow as easily as water. The target can move through ice or snow at a half speed.

When the spell ends, if you are in a space currently occupied by ice you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved. If you are in a space currently occupied by snow, you are buried by the snow, {@condition restrained}, and cannot breathe.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature

spell.name: Snowsight
entries: You touch a creature and grant it the ability to see even in whiteout conditions. For the duration, the target can see up to 60 feet through areas heavily obscured by falling nonmagical snow as if it were only lightly obscured. The target is also immune to the effects of snow glare and snow blindness, and has advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition blinded} by bright light.

spell.name: Jennia's Investiture of Stone
entries: Until the spell ends, bits of rock spread across your body, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +2 bonus to AC and have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

While standing on the ground, you can use your bonus action to create a {@dice 1d4 × 10} foot deep fissure on the ground in a 10-foot wide, 30-foot long line. Other creatures on that ground take {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is knocked {@condition prone} and falls into the fissure. On a successful save, the damage is halved and the creature moves with the fissure's edge as it opens. A fissure that opens beneath a structure deals siege damage to it and might cause it to buckle and collapse at the DM's discretion.

You can move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without spending extra movement. You can also move through solid earth or stone as if it was air and without destabilizing it, but you can't end your movement there. If you do so, you are ejected to the nearest unoccupied space, this spell ends, and you are {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Lo'Ra's Investiture of Wind
entries: Until the spell ends, wind whirls around you, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a flying speed of 60 feet and you are immune to effects caused by wind. If you are still flying when the spell ends, you fall, unless you can somehow prevent it.

The air within a 15-foot radius of you is a powerful whirlwind (30 miles per hour) that moves within you. This wind deafens creatures other than you, disperses gas and fog, and extinguishes unprotected flames within the area. The area is difficult terrain for creatures other than you. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched into the area are swept up by the wind and directed back at the attacker (Use the original attack roll, boulders hurled by giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected). Creatures that start their turn within the area or enter the area for the first time on their turn must succeed a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and be thrown ({@dice 1d4 + 1}) × 5 feet directly away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.

You can use your bonus action to create a 15-foot cube of buffeting wind centered on a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a Large or smaller creature fails the save, that creature is also pushed up to 15 feet in a direction you choose.

spell.name: Liara's Investiture of Flame
entries: Flames race across your body, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet for the spell's duration. The flames don't harm you. Until the spell ends, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to fire damage and have resistance to cold damage.
Any creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of you or comes within range for the first time on its turn takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage.

If you deal fire damage to a creature or flammable object, it starts burning. At the start of each of its turns, a creature burning in this way takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage. A creature that can reach the burning target can use an action to extinguish the fire.

You can use a bonus action on your turn to emit a blast of flame. Creatures within 20 feet of you must make a dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful save.

spell.name: Fimbulwinter

m.text: a sapphire worth at least 20,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You plunge the weather within 20 miles of the point where you cast this spell into a state of severe winter for the duration, or strengthen winter conditions that are already present. You must be outdoors to cast this spell. You cannot control or alter the conditions of the spell while outside of its area or in a place where you don't have a clear view of the sky.

When you cast the spell, you change the current weather conditions, which are determined by the DM based on the climate and season, to a set of wintry conditions. It takes 10 minutes for the new conditions to take effect. Once they do so, you can use your action to change the conditions again.

Daily conditions of the wind and snowfall during the spell are determined at dawn each day using the table below. Add a +8 to the roll during winter, +4 during spring or autumn, or a -2 during summer. Add a +2 in areas with a naturally cold climate, -2 for temperate climates, and a -6 for hot climates. Roll separately to determine wind and snow. The snow and wind shown are the maximum possible for that day. You can use your action to set a new condition for less wind or snow, or to change the wind's direction, which takes effect over the next 10 minutes.
