A dispel magic spell can end the spell only if it is cast as a 7th-level spell or higher while targeting the point where you cast the spell. When the spell ends, the weather gradually returns to normal over 10 minutes.

spell.name: Snowsong
entries: You weave a magical wintry tune that emboldens allies and spurns enemies within 30 feet of you. Until the spell ends, the sphere moves with you, centered on you. For the duration, each friendly creature in the area can see a soft, gentle snowfall that evaporates on contact with anything solid and hear a soft, lilting song that bolsters their spirits and confidence.

Wherever the snow touches, it melts and washes away wounds, scars, and filth. Each friendly creature resistance to cold damage, advantage on attack rolls as well as Charisma ability checks and saving throws, and other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against them until the spell ends. Additionally, a friendly creature regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns while in the area, and its melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

For enemies within the area, the snow is bitterly cold and burns the skin on contact. If a creature starts its turn in the spell's area or enters the area for the first time on its turn, and is concentrating on a spell, the creature must make a successful Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or lose concentration. They perceive the music as a discordant jangle of crashing, scraping, shrieking, and howling. If an enemy attempts to cast a spell with verbal components while in the area, it must make a spellcasting ability check against your spell save DC or fail to cast the spell. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, they are immune to the spell for the rest of its duration.

spell.name: Volcanic Storm
entries: You create a black roiling cloud filled with smoke and burning ash in the shape of a cylinder that is 90 feet tall with a 30-foot radius, centered on a point you can see within range directly above you. The spell fails if you can't see a point in the air where the storm cloud could appear (for example, if you are in a room that can't accommodate the cloud).

Fiery embers and ash rain down and the swirling ash causes static red lightning to jump and arc within the area. Creatures that start their turn within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d6} fire damage and {@damage 2d6} lightning damage, halved on a success. The embers ignite flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

When you cast the spell, choose a point you can see under the cloud. A bolt of red lightning flashes down from the cloud to that point. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d10} lightning damage and {@damage 2d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to call down lightning in this way again, targeting the same point or a different one.

If you are outdoors within 10 miles of a volcano or another area with heavy smoke and ash, such as a wildfire, when you cast this spell, the spell draws power from the existing conditions. Under such conditions, the spell's lightning and fire damage increase by {@dice 1d10} each.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the fire damage or the lightning damage (your choice)  dealt by the red lightning bolt increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Smoky Shapes
entries: You create three smoky duplicates that resemble an outline of yourself with smoldering embers for eyes. When you cast the spell, and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use your bonus action to cause each of the duplicates to move up to 30 feet and make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage and must make a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. You cannot command a duplicate if it is more than 60 feet from you.

If you are targeted by an attack during the spell's duration, you can use your reaction to swap places with one of your duplicates and cause the attack to target it instead. You must choose to do this before the outcome of the attack is determined.

A duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a duplicate, the duplicate is destroyed, unless that attack does fire damage. A duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

spell.name: Bind Dread Warrior

m.text: a jeweled dagger worth 250 gp, an embalmer's kit, a Medium humanoid corpse, and 750 gp worth of diamond dust, incense, herbs, and oils which the spell consumes

entries: Through dark rituals and experimentations, you create a vessel for an undead creature known as a Dread Warrior. This spirit is then bound to you, and will follow your commands to the best of its ability. It is intelligent and has a malevolent disposition, meaning it will take advantage of your orders and twist them to commit evil when convenient. It acts on its own initiative, and has proficiency in all forms of armor, simple and martial weapons, and shields. Your Dread Warrior uses your proficiency bonus in place of its own and gains a bonus to its hit point maximum equal to half your hit point maximum.

You have a psychic link with your Dread Warrior that allows telepathic communication when within 100 feet. As an action, you can take fine control of your Dread Warrior while it is within 100 feet of you, seeing through its eyes and hearing what it hears, as well as deciding what it does. While doing so, you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to the world around you.
Your Dread Warrior is able to issue commands on your behalf to any undead you create, though your orders will always supersede those of the Dread Warrior.

As part of this spell, you must cut yourself with a jeweled dagger worth no less than 250 gold pieces and sacrifice some of your blood and life essence. When you do this, your hit point maximum decreases by 5, and your Strength score decreases by 1. This decrease persists for so long as your Dread Warrior lives. If your Dread Warrior is destroyed, your strength and hit points do not return until you complete a long rest. Due to the massive strain on your life essence that comes with animating a Dread Warrior, you may only have one bound at a time.

spell.name: Cassius's Negative Orb

m.text: A black pearl worth 50 gp

entries: You create a bead of antilife magic at a point of your choice within range. When the bead takes form, all creatures within a 10-foot-radius sphere, centered on the bead must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, affected creatures take {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. The anti-life magic lingers in the area for 1 minute, making it impossible for creatures within the area to regain hit points.
This spell does not have any effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Kal's Contingency

m.text: a statuette of yourself carved from ivory and decorated with gems worth at least 1,500 gp

entries: Choose a spell of 5th level or lower that you can cast and that can target you. You cast that spell—called the contingent spell—as part of casting contingency, expending spell slots for both, but the contingent spell doesn't come into effect. Instead, it takes effect when a certain circumstance occurs. You describe that circumstance when you cast the two spells. For example, a contingency cast with water breathing might stipulate that water breathing comes into effect when you are engulfed in water or a similar liquid.
The contingent spell takes effect immediately after the circumstance is met for the first time, whether or not you want it to, and then contingency ends.

The contingent spell takes effect only on you, even if it can normally target others. You can use only one contingency spell at a time. If you cast this spell again, the effect of another contingency spell on you ends. Also, contingency ends on you if its material component is ever not on your person.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 7th level spell slot, the contingent spell can be up to 6th level. When you cast this spell using a 8th level spell slot, the contingent spell can be up to 7th level.

spell.name: Energy Ward
entries: For the duration, the willing creature you touch is warded against 40 points of one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. When the creature would take damage of the chosen type, the ward takes the damage instead.
Damage reductions from resistance do not apply to the ward's HP.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the ward's hp increases by 10 per level above 3rd.

spell.name: Outsider's Ward
entries: For the duration, the willing creature you touch is warded against 30 points of one damage type of your choice: radiant, necrotic, or psychic. When the creature would take damage of the chosen type, the ward takes the damage instead.
Damage reductions from resistance do not apply to the ward's HP.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the ward's hp increases by 10 per level above 3rd.

spell.name: Liara's Incendiary Cloud
entries: A swirling cloud of smoke shot through with white-hot embers appears in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of fast or greater speed (at least 21 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
You can move the cloud up to 30 feet in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns with no action required on your part.

spell.name: Rathena's Investiture of Ice
entries: Until the spell ends, ice rimes your body, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to cold damage and have resistance to fire damage.

You can move across difficult terrain created by ice or snow without spending extra movement. Nonmagical liquids freeze in a 10-foot radius around you, provided that there are no creatures in the liquid's area. This allows you to walk across the liquid as if it were solid ground. Not all liquids lose their properties when frozen. For example, frozen lava may still be extremely hot to the touch, and frozen acid may still sting or even cause damage in extreme concentrations.

The ground in a 10-foot radius around you is icy difficult terrain. The radius moves with you. Creatures that start their turn within the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw or slip and fall {@condition prone} on the ice. You can skate on this slippery ice at double your normal movement.

You can use your bonus action to create a 30-foot cone of freezing air extending from your outstretched hand in a direction you choose. Each creature in the cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} cold damage and is {@condition restrained} by a coating of ice until the end of its next turn. On a success, the damage is halved and the target is not {@condition restrained}. A creature that is hit by this effect has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Investiture of Lava
entries: Until the spell ends, your body is run through with cracks that spill forth molten lava, covering your skin without burning you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to fire damage and resistant to bludgeoning damage.
Any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack while within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage
If you deal fire damage to a creature, molten rock hardens to its body, causing its speed to be halved until a creature uses its action to remove it.
You gain a burrow speed equal to your movement and can burrow through solid rock at half your burrow speed.

You leave behind a 5-foot wide path of molten lava whenever you move. This lava is difficult terrain and lasts until the start of your next turn. If a creature enters the area for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there, it takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage.

spell.name: Investiture of Smoke
entries: Until the spell ends, your body becomes wreathed in a billowing cloud of smoke and ash, your eyes become burning pinpoints like smoldering embers, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to fire damage and resistant to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
You gain a flying speed of 30 feet. If you are still flying when the spell ends, you fall, unless you can somehow prevent it.

The area in a 30-foot radius around you becomes filled with an acrid cloud of smoke and ash. Within this radius, you have blindsight. The area is heavily obscured for creatures other than you. Any creature that ends its turn within the area takes {@damage 4d4} fire damage and must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} and {@condition incapacitated} as it is overcome with hacking, coughing, and choking until the end of its next turn. A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke, but it immediately reforms at the start of your next turn.

You can use your bonus action to create a smoky updraft of searing strong wind (30 miles per hour) in a 15-foot radius cylinder 30-feet high within 60 feet of you. This area is heavily obscured and difficult terrain. A creature that starts its turn in the area or enters it for the first time on their turn takes {@damage 4d4} fire damage and must make a Strength saving throw or be thrown up into the air 30 feet and pushed 20 feet away from the center of the cylinder, falling {@condition prone} back to the ground. This area persists until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Investiture of Ooze
entries: Until the spell ends, your body becomes engulfed in a roiling mass of acrid ooze and thick swirling mud, and you gains the following benefits:

items: You are immune to acid damage and resistant to slashing damage.

Any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack while within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits you corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits you is destroyed after dealing damage. Your acid can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

If you deal acid damage to a creature, it is coated in a persistent caustic ooze that deals {@damage 2d4} acid damage at the start of each of its turns until a creature uses its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. In addition, nonmagical or natural armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers each time a creature takes this damage. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. Natural armor affected in this way can be repaired by magical healing or a short or long rest.

You can use a bonus action to launch a bubble of corrosive slime at a point you can see within 30 feet. Creatures within a 15-foot radius of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw or be engulfed by the slime. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} acid damage and is {@condition restrained} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the damage is halved and the creature is not {@condition restrained}. The area is filled with popping and sizzling slime until the end of your next turn. That area is difficult terrain, and a creature takes {@damage 4d6} acid damage if it ends its turn there. A creature {@condition restrained} by the slime can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

spell.name: Investiture of Steam
entries: Until the spell ends, your body gives off a cloud of billowing steam that can burn flesh, but does not harm you, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to fire damage and resistant to cold damage.
You gain a flying speed of 30 feet. If you are still flying when the spell ends, you fall, unless you can somehow prevent it.

You can use your bonus action to create a cloud of scalding steam in a 40-foot cube centered on a point you can see within 60 feet. This cube is heavily obscured for creatures other than you. The area is filled with boiling rain that extinguishes open flames, and any creature that enters the cube for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage. You can move between any two spaces within the cube using only 5 feet of movement. The steam lasts until the spell ends, or you use your bonus action to create another cube. A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the steam.

The area within 10 feet of you is heavily obscured for creatures other than you by a billowing cloud of hot steam. Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of you or comes within range for the first time on its turn takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage. This steam flows outward from your body like a 15 mile per hour boiling wind. This wind disperses other gases and vapor other than steam and extinguishes unprotected flames.

spell.name: Breath Weapon Admixture
entries: As part of the action to cast this spell you use a breath weapon, consuming its charge as normal. Choose one damage type from the following acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison, your breath weapon does extra damage dice equal to the base damage dice of the breath weapon of the chosen damage type.

spell.name: Dispelling breath
entries: As part of the action to cast this spell you use a breath weapon, consuming its charge as normal. For each creature that fails its saving throw against your breath weapon, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability +5, for each magical effect you know of on each target. For spells, the DC equals 10 + the caster's proficiency bonus + the spell's level. For magical effects, the DC equals the save DC of the effect. On a successful check, the magical effect of on the target ends.

spell.name: Breath Flair

components.m: a breath weapon that deals fire or lightning damage

entries: As part of the action to cast this spell you use a breath weapon, consuming its charge as normal. The breath weapon used is suffused with bright light; each creature that takes damage from the breath weapon must make a constitution saving throw against your breath weapon DC or be {@condition blinded} for one minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Breath Weapon Substitution
entries: As part of the action to cast this spell you use a breath weapon, consuming its charge as normal. Choose one damage type from the following acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison, your breath weapon's damage type changes to the chosen damage type.

spell.name: Syletza's Angelic Form

m.text: an object engraved with a symbol of the lower planes, worth at least 500 gp

entries: Uttering an incantation, you draw on the magic of the Lower Planes to transform your being. You gain the following benefits until the spell ends.,

items: You have resistance to radiant and necrotic damage.
You gain two pairs of radiant wings that grant you a flight speed of 60 feet. These wings shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. This light is sunlight.
You gain 15 temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns.
When you hit a target with a weapon attack or a melee spell attack, that target takes an extra {@damage 2d10} radiant damage.
You have advantage on attack rolls that you make against targets that are in bright light.
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.

entries: Immediately after this spell ends, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Investiture of Dust
entries: Until the spell ends, your body is enveloped in a swirling cloud of dust and you gain the following benefits:

items: Dust rises up beneath your feet wherever you walk. You ignore difficult terrain, and can walk up into the air on a platform of dust. You change your altitude as you run through the air at a speed equal to half your movement.

Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of you or comes within that range for the first time on its turn takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage and must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn as they are buffeted by the raging dust storm. This area is difficult terrain for creatures other than you, and the attack rolls of ranged weapon attacks have disadvantage if the attacks pass in or out of the area.

You can use your bonus action to create a wall of swirling dust up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 10 feet thick, within 60 feet, that lasts until the end of your next turn. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It blocks line of sight but not movement. A creature is {@condition blinded} while in the wall's space and must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves there. Any creature that enters the area of the wall for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 4d8 bludgeoning damage as the dust surges around them. On a success, the damage is halved. You are immune to the wall’s effects, and if you ever enter the wall’s space, you can exit at any other space adjacent to the wall using 5 feet of movement.

spell.name: Investiture of Storms
entries: Until the spell ends, your body becomes a conduit of electrical energy, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to lighting and resistant to thunder damage.

Any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack while within 5 feet of you takes 2d8 lighting damage. Any creature wearing or holding metal within 30 feet of you also takes this damage at the start of each of your turns.
You can convert any amount of your movement on each of your turns into flight. If you don’t land by the end of this flight, you fall unless you have other means of staying aloft.
If you deal lightning damage to a creature, it must succeed on a constitution saving throw or be unable to take reactions until the end of its next turn.

As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can launch a lance of lightning at a creature within 120 feet. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the creature takes 2d10 lightning damage and 2d10 thunder damage and you can cause the lightning to arc from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of it. The second creature takes half the damage of the attack.
